text_devanagari: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच। धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः।
text_iast: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca | dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ |
notes: Dhritarashtra said: On the holy field of Kurukshetra, assembled and eager to fight

text_iast: māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāścaiva kimakurvata sañjaya |
notes: What did my sons and the Pandavas do, O Sanjaya?

text_iast: karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana |
notes: You have a right to perform your prescribed duty, but not to the fruits of action

text_iast: mā karmaphalahetur bhūr mā te saṅgo 'stvakarmaṇi |
notes: Never consider yourself the cause of the results of your activities, and never be attached to not doing your duty

text_devanagari: ॐ ईशावास्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत्।
text_iast: oṃ īśāvāsyamidaṃ sarvaṃ yatkiñca jagatyāṃ jagat |
notes: Om! All this is pervaded by the Lord, whatever moves in this moving world

text_devanagari: तेन त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथा मा गृधः कस्यस्विद्धनम्।
text_iast: tena tyaktena bhuñjīthā mā gṛdhaḥ kasyasvid dhanam |
notes: Therefore enjoy by renunciation; do not covet anyone's wealth

text_iast: oṃ pūrṇamadaḥ pūrṇamidaṃ pūrṇātpūrṇamudacyate |
notes: Om! That (Brahman) is complete, this (creation) is complete. From the complete comes the complete

text_iast: pūrṇasya pūrṇamādāya pūrṇamevāvaśiṣyate |
notes: Taking the complete from the complete, the complete alone remains

text_iast: oṃ bhūrbhuvaḥ svaḥ tatsaviturvarēṇyam |
notes: Om! Earth, atmosphere, heaven. That most excellent light of the divine Sun

text_devanagari: भर्गो देवस्य धीमहि धियो यो नः प्रचोदयात्।
text_iast: bhargo devasya dhīmahi dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt |
notes: We meditate on the effulgent light of that divine Being; may He direct our intellect

text_devanagari: धर्मो विश्वस्य जगतः प्रतिष्ठा लोके धर्मिष्ठं प्रजा उपसर्पन्ति।
text_iast: dharmo viśvasya jagataḥ pratiṣṭhā loke dharmiṣṭhaṃ prajā upasarpanti |
notes: Dharma is the foundation of the universe; people approach the most righteous in the world

text_iast: yogaḥ karmasu kauśalam |
notes: Yoga is skill in action

text_devanagari: सत्यमेव जयते नानृतं सत्येन पन्था विततो देवयानः।
text_iast: satyameva jayate nānṛtaṃ satyena panthā vitato devayānaḥ |
notes: Truth alone triumphs, not falsehood. By truth the divine path is spread out

text_devanagari: अहिंसा परमो धर्मः धर्म हिंसा तथैव च।
text_iast: ahiṃsā paramo dharmaḥ dharma hiṃsā tathaiva ca |
notes: Non-violence is the supreme dharma; so too is violence in the service of dharma

text_iast: vidyā dadāti vinayaṃ vinayādyāti pātratām |
notes: Knowledge gives humility; from humility comes worthiness

text_iast: gururbrahmā gururviṣṇuḥ gururdevo maheśvaraḥ |
notes: The guru is Brahma, the guru is Vishnu, the guru is the great Lord Shiva

text_devanagari: कालः पचति भूतानि कालः संहरते प्रजाः।
text_iast: kālaḥ pacati bhūtāni kālaḥ saṃharate prajāḥ |
notes: Time cooks all beings; time destroys all creatures

text_iast: sarvadharmānparityajya māmekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja |
notes: Abandoning all varieties of dharma, just surrender unto Me alone

text_iast: mana eva manuṣyāṇāṃ kāraṇaṃ bandhamokṣayoḥ |
notes: Mind alone is the cause of bondage and liberation for human beings

text_iast: ahaṃ brahmāsmi |
notes: I am Brahman - one of the four great sayings (mahavakyas)

text_devanagari: सर्वं खल्विदं ब्रह्म तज्जलानिति शान्त उपासीत।
text_iast: sarvaṃ khalvidaṃ brahma tajjalāniti śānta upāsīta |
notes: All this is indeed Brahman; from It all beings originate, in It they dissolve. One should worship in tranquility

text_devanagari: दया धर्म का मूल है पाप मूल अभिमान।
text_iast: dayā dharma kā mūla hai pāpa mūla abhimāna |
notes: Compassion is the root of dharma; pride is the root of sin

text_iast: paropakāraḥ puṇyāya pāpāya parapīḍanam |
notes: Helping others leads to merit; harming others leads to sin

text_devanagari: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय।
text_iast: yogasthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā dhanañjaya |
notes: Established in yoga, perform actions, abandoning attachment, O Dhananjaya

text_devanagari: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते।
text_iast: na hi jñānena sadṛśaṃ pavitramiha vidyate |
notes: Indeed, there is nothing as pure as knowledge in this world
